question_text: I was scammed by a fake job offer in Kochi, what should I do?
golden_answer: File a complaint at Kerala Cyber Cell or through cybercrime.gov.in. Attach all emails, chats, and transaction proofs.

question_text: What is the punishment for online identity theft?
golden_answer: Section 66C of IT Act 2000: imprisonment up to 3 years and/or ?1 lakh fine.

question_text: Someone hacked my Instagram account, what can I do?
golden_answer: Report to Instagram, change passwords, and file a complaint under Sections 43 & 66 of IT Act.

question_text: How can I report cybercrime in Kerala?
golden_answer: Visit cybercrime.gov.in or the nearest District Cyber Cell; you can also dial 1930 for financial frauds.

question_text: What is Section 67 of IT Act 2000?
golden_answer: Publishing or transmitting obscene material online: up to 3 years jail and ?5 lakh fine.

question_text: What is the Kozhikode Cyber Cell contact number?
golden_answer: Kozhikode Cyber Cell: +91-495-2723500 / cybercrime.gov.in.

question_text: Someone is blackmailing me with my private photos online, what should I do?
golden_answer: Report to Cyber Cell under Section 66E (violation of privacy) and 67A (sexual content).

question_text: Can I file a cyber complaint without visiting the police station?
golden_answer: Yes, use https://cybercrime.gov.in and submit digital evidence.

question_text: What are common types of cybercrimes?
golden_answer: Phishing, identity theft, online fraud, hacking, cyberbullying, data breach, and obscenity.

question_text: What is the punishment for sending obscene messages?
golden_answer: Section 67 IT Act: up to 3 years imprisonment + ?5 lakh fine.

question_text: I received a phishing email from a fake bank site. What to do?
golden_answer: Don’t click links; forward to reportphishing@apwg.org and file at cybercrime.gov.in.

question_text: What is cyberstalking?
golden_answer: Repeated online harassment or monitoring of someone’s activity; punishable under Section 354D IPC and 66A IT Act.

question_text: What is the helpline number for financial fraud?
golden_answer: Dial 1930 (Indian Cybercrime Helpline).

question_text: How do I protect my social media accounts?
golden_answer: Enable 2FA, use strong passwords, avoid sharing OTP or personal data.

question_text: Can minors be punished under IT Act?
golden_answer: Yes, but tried under Juvenile Justice Act if below 18 years.

question_text: What is Section 66D of IT Act?
golden_answer: Cheating by personation using computer resources; up to 3 years jail + ?1 lakh fine.

question_text: Is publishing fake news online a cybercrime?
golden_answer: Yes, if it incites violence or defamation; liable under IPC and IT Act.

question_text: What steps should I take if I lose money in an online trading scam?
golden_answer: Call 1930 immediately and report on cybercrime.gov.in with transaction details.

question_text: How can I verify a website is genuine?
golden_answer: Check https certificate, domain age, and avoid unofficial links.

question_text: What is the penalty for tampering with computer data?
golden_answer: Section 65 IT Act: up to 3 years imprisonment or ?2 lakh fine.

question_text: What law protects digital personal data in India?
golden_answer: Digital Personal Data Protection Act 2023.

question_text: How do I file a complaint for online loan app harassment?
golden_answer: File through cybercrime.gov.in and contact local police under Sections 66E & 72 IT Act.

question_text: What is doxxing?
golden_answer: Public sharing of private data without consent; punishable under Section 66E.

question_text: Can I remain anonymous while filing a cybercrime complaint?
golden_answer: Yes, you can choose “Report anonymously” option on cybercrime.gov.in.

question_text: What is ransomware?
golden_answer: Malware that encrypts data and demands ransom; report immediately to Cyber Cell.

question_text: Who regulates cyber laws in India?
golden_answer: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY).

question_text: What is Section 43 of IT Act?
golden_answer: Penalizes unauthorized access to computer systems — fine up to ?1 crore.

question_text: How do I contact the Ernakulam Cyber Cell?
golden_answer: Ernakulam Cyber Cell: +91-484-2359200.

question_text: Can I withdraw a cyber complaint?
golden_answer: Yes, before FIR registration with valid reason.

question_text: What is the penalty for data theft by employees?
golden_answer: Section 72 IT Act: up to 2 years imprisonment + ?1 lakh fine.

question_text: What is a fake OTP fraud?
golden_answer: Trick to steal bank OTP; never share with anyone; report to 1930.

question_text: What law covers cyber bullying of students?
golden_answer: IPC Section 509 and IT Act Sections 66E & 67.

question_text: My Facebook page was hacked and used for scams.
golden_answer: Recover via Facebook support and file complaint under Section 66.

question_text: What is digital signature fraud?
golden_answer: Section 73 IT Act — imprisonment up to 2 years + fine.

question_text: What should I do if I get a sextortion threat?
golden_answer: Don’t pay money; report to cybercrime.gov.in under Sections 67A and 384 IPC.

question_text: What is the difference between phishing and vishing?
golden_answer: Phishing = email/web fraud; Vishing = voice call fraud.

question_text: How long does cyber complaint investigation take?
golden_answer: Varies case-by-case; initial response within 7-10 days.

question_text: What is the role of CERT-In?
golden_answer: Handles cybersecurity incidents and threat response in India.

question_text: Can sharing memes be a cyber offense?
golden_answer: Yes, if content is obscene or defamatory — liable under Sections 67 & 499 IPC.

question_text: How do I complain about a fake Instagram profile?
golden_answer: Report through Instagram and Cyber Cell under Section 66C.

question_text: What is Section 69 of IT Act?
golden_answer: Allows authorized government interception of data for security purposes.

question_text: Can cyber crimes be reported after months?
golden_answer: Yes, provide timestamped evidence like emails or screenshots.

question_text: What is the punishment for cyber terrorism?
golden_answer: Section 66F IT Act: life imprisonment.

question_text: What is data retention policy under DPDP Act 2023?
golden_answer: Data must be deleted once purpose is fulfilled unless consent is renewed.

question_text: Is cyber defamation a crime in India?
golden_answer: Yes, under Section 499 IPC and Section 66A IT Act (if abusive online).

question_text: Can companies be punished for data breach?
golden_answer: Yes, under DPDP Act 2023 and IT Act Sections 43A & 72A.

question_text: How can I check if a loan app is fake?
golden_answer: Verify on RBI website; avoid apps asking for unnecessary permissions.

question_text: What is Section 66B of IT Act?
golden_answer: Receiving stolen computer resources; up to 3 years jail or ?1 lakh fine.

question_text: How to complain about cyber crime in Kerala offline?
golden_answer: Visit nearest Cyber Cell station with ID proof and evidence.

question_text: What is the jurisdiction for cyber crimes in India?
golden_answer: Any court where the offense originated or was felt can take cognizance (Section 75 IT Act).
